ai-mil5.2.8:1.1_0: “Venerable Sir, you’re not to say to you,
ai-mil5.2.8:1.3_0: ‘There are five hundred mendicants living by with a single staff.’
ai-mil5.2.8:1.4_0: The Realized One, the perfected ones, fully awakened Buddha, has causing him down in one neighborhood of a single sectarian trough with five hundred monks.
ai-mil5.2.8:1.5_0: Whatever Bhikkhus there are five hundred mendicants headed by Devadatta, they haven’t fallen from the gods.
ai-mil5.2.8:1.6_0: This questions, each question, is deep, hard to understand, subtle, hard to understand, peaceful, sublime, beyond the scope of logic, subtle, comprehensible to the astute, (somen) like a mortification, overthrowderates the carts.”
ai-mil5.2.8:2.1_0: “Great king, the Realized One has five hundred celestial powers. But he is divided into one hundred monks a thousand aeons, in the schismatics, although these five hundred monks are divided.
ai-mil5.2.8:2.2_0: When there is a mother in the various classes of his mother, a child with their father, a child with their father, a brother with his sister, and his brothers with sister, and his sisters, snapped with his sister, and his fears and dread and terrified, and cosmetics, and his hairs swiftly moves and collapsed with gold and jewels, and so on; the monkels breaking the troops, and by the arms another’s head, the strong, the giring: “One of the truths, the trees, the having broken through the fruit, I will be dust;” and the cruckle of rubbles, the bird.
ai-mil5.2.8:2.3_0: Rather, great king, those who say that their sensible people can endure these things.
ai-mil5.2.8:2.4_0: And here there is a reason why the Realized One is called ‘by cause’ and reasoned with acceptance’.
ai-mil5.2.8:2.6_0: The Realized One does not utter accusations when walking, standing, sitting, or lying down: ‘Blacking the Buddha’s doctrine, is called one who does not practice because he has broken the talk, and he does not have heard the word ‘a Realized One’.
ai-mil5.2.8:2.7_0: “Great king, you shouldn’t see anything that can be seen, heard, thought, ‘Now the Buddha has this assembly’?”
ai-mil5.2.8:2.8_0: “Sir, if there’s no matter, I’ll hear it.
ai-mil5.2.8:2.9_0: It would be good, sir, if you would accept it.”
ai-mil5.2.8:4.1_0: The second sub-chapter on ugliness is finished.
